title: South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 25
text:
© Reuters. South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 25

JOHANNESBURG, Sept 25 (Reuters) - The following scheduled economic indicators, debt and currency market moves may affect South African markets on Wednesday.

ECONOMIC EVENTS

SARB quarterly bulletin

Government bond auction

SOUTH AFRICAN MARKETS

South African financial markets were closed on Tuesday for a public holiday. .J ZAR/

GLOBAL MARKETS

Asian stocks fell on Wednesday after U.S. lawmakers called for an impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump, increasing the prospects of prolonged political uncertainty in the world's largest economy. MKTS/GLOB

WALL STREET

U.S. stocks fell in volatile trade on Tuesday, giving the S&P 500 its biggest daily drop in a month as a push for the impeachment of U.S. President Donald Trump gained momentum among Democrats in the U.S. Congress. .N

GOLD

Gold prices inched lower on Wednesday as some investors booked profit, but the metal remained supported below a three-week peak hit in the prior session. GOL/

Some of the main stories out in the South African press:

BUSINESS DAY

- Cyril Ramaphosa fights threats to NPA restructuring

- Environmentalists to fight oil and gas drilling off KwaZulu-Natal coast
description: South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 25
